comments: When I mount a GridFTP filesystem using the new add filesystem link wizard and open open the mounted filesystem I sometimes get an incomplete listing (depending on the directory). There are always the same files missing.

Created an attachment (id=74408)
Screenshot of the listing of the geclipse home on hydra.

Added screenshot of the listing of the geclipse home on hydra (there should be much more files)

Thomas, could you please provide me the exact directory location of the hydra (Is it /home/agrid/geclipse or so ?) and the current list of items that should be contained in this directory? Or even better would be to have an ssh login for that machine. So if possible it would be nice if you could create one for me for debugging purposes (I already have one at the egee-ce1).

Created an attachment (id=74516)
Listing of the current contents of the geclipse home dir on hydra

Yesterday I tried again to list the same directory and it worked. I don't know whats different (maybe the contents of directory changed). I wanted to try again today but it failed because of another reason (see comment in bug # 197218)

The directory is /home/local/agrid/geclipse, I have attached the current file listing. If your firewall allows it you should be able to log into hydra using glogin. If your firewall does not allow that please talk to Martin for an account.

I've tried now to mount egee-ce1 (by right clicking on the entry in the storage elements and adding using the mount action). When I try to open the egee-ce1 mount point I get following exception:

eu.geclipse.efs.gridftp.internal.GridFTPException: Server refused performing the request.

eu.geclipse.efs.gridftp.internal.GridFTPException[15]: org.globus.ftp.exception.ServerException: Server refused performing the request. Custom message: Server refused changing transfer mode (error code 1) [Nested exception message:  Custom message: Unexpected reply: 550 /dpm/gup.uni-linz.ac.at/home/geclipseoutput.txt: No such file or directory.].  Nested exception is org.globus.ftp.exception.UnexpectedReplyCodeException:  Custom message: Unexpected reply: 550 /dpm/gup.uni-linz.ac.at/home/geclipseoutput.txt: No such file or directory.
at org.globus.ftp.vanilla.FTPControlChannel.execute(FTPControlChannel.java:333)

The exception in my last comment seems to be caused be the mount action (right click on the storage element), which I used to create the mount. It seems that it uses a wrong path.
This item seemed to be related to synchronization issues with the eclipse resource management. Within the bug fixing phase of the g-Eclipse filesystem this issue should be fixed now.

traces.message: Custom message: Unexpected reply: 550 /dpm/gup.uni-linz.ac.at/home/geclipseoutput.txt: No such file or directory.
